commit.message:
Salted Hash Generator & MemoryUtils

- Created a salted hash generator that uses a secret seed, together with
ReproducibleSaltGenerator, to provide a Iterator for iterating over the
salted hashes for a given cleartext value.
  For a given secret seed, the Iterator produced for a given cleartext
value will always return the same sequence of salted hashes.

- Created a MemoryUtils utility class, providing functions for
concatenating an array of byte-array buffers and another for clearing a
sensitive byte-array buffer (with zeros).

- Updated HashingUtils to use the buffer concatenating feature of
MemoryUtils, instead of manually concatenating the cleartext and salt
byte-arrays when preparing to create the (SHA-256) hash, using
System.arraycopy(...).

- Created an application.yml configuration file, adding a
'securerandom.drbg.config' property configuring the DRBG associated with
a SecureRandom created with SecureRandom algorithm "DRBG".
  Configured the DRBG to use Hash_DRBG with SHA-256 and a security
strength of 128 bits, sufficient for production of 16 B salt values.

repository.name: crypto-hashing
repository.description: Secure Hashing API supporting efficient querying by sensitive parameters

* refactor: 토큰 값을 캐싱하여 저장하는 TokenManager 생성 및 적용

- 매번 runBlocking을 통해 Preference에 저장된 토큰 값을 불러오는 것은 네트워크 성능을 저하시킨다.
- 따라서, token 값을 캐싱하여 저장하는 TokenManager를 활용한다.
  - 첫 네트워크 요청 시에만 토큰을 불러오는 작업을 동기적으로 처리하기 위해 Main Thread가 Blocking 된다.
  - TokenManager가 Preference로부터 가져온 토큰을 캐싱하여 저장한다.
  - 이후 요청부터는 캐시된 토큰을 가져오므로 Main Thread가 Blocking 되지 않는다.

* fix: root뷰 터치 시 클릭 이벤트가 발생하지 않는 오류 수정

- 원인 분석: ConstraintLayout 내부 Toolbar 및 ScrollView, 그리고 그 자식 View들이 클릭 이벤트를 가로채기 때문에, 바인딩 된 최상단 root 뷰인 ConstraintLayout의 클릭 이벤트가 동작하지 않는다.

- 해결 방법: 여러 클릭 이벤트를 가로채는 dispatchTouchEvent 메서드를 오버라이드하여, 터치된 부분이 현재 포커스가 되지 않은 View(키보드 바깥 화면) 범위라면, 키보드를 숨기는 동작을 추가하였다.

* refactor: 키보드 숨김 동작을 handler 바인딩으로 적용

- LoginHandler 에 화면 터치에 대한 동작을 추가, 화면 터치 시 키보드를 숨김 처리하는 동작을 바인딩으로 설정
- InputMethodManager 인스턴스를 지연초기화하여 저장

* refactor: InputMethodManager 인스턴스를 lazy로 지연 초기화

commit.message:
samba: Autospec creation for update from version 4.18.5 to version 4.20.2

Alexander Bokovoy (3):
      Add ROLE_IPA_DC into two more places
      wafsamba: Normalize strings in gdb output when comparing ABI
      Do not fail checksums for RFC8009 types

Amir Goldstein (4):
      s4:torture:basic: fix SET_INFO_* macros in delayed_write_update*
      lib: add NTTIME_[U|m]SEC macros
      s4:torture:basic: use milliseconds granularity in delayed_write_update7
      torture/smb2: do not use client time in delayed timestamp updates test

Andreas Schneider (457):
      python: Don't use deprecated escape sequences
      lib:util: Remove trailing whitespaces from time.c
      lib:util: Print data in ISO 8601 format
      lib:param: Remove trailing whitespaces from loadparm.c
      param: Use a higher time resolution for lp_file_list_changed()
      python:tests: Avoid exceptions in cleanup code if a test fails in smb3unix.py
      selftest: Only run samba.tests.smb3unix in developer mode
      s3:tests: Add support for SMBD_DONT_LOG_STDOUT=1 in test_chdir_cache.sh
      selftest: Update devel_env.sh for SAMBA_DCERPCD_DONT_LOG_STDOUT=1
      script:autobuild: Make sure we can send a failure mail
      s3:libsmb: Remove unused variable 'i'
      s3:smbd: Don't assign variable to itself
      s3:rpcsrv:eventlog: Remove unused variable
      s3:winbind: Remove unused variable
      s4:samdb: Remove trailing whitespaces
      s4:samdb: Remove unused variable
      nsswitch: Fix getting data out of pam_get_data()
      lib:ldb-samba: Correctly handle search scope
      s3:printing: Remove trailing whitespaces in vlp.c
      s3:printing: Remove unused variable
      s3:modules: Ignore -Wunused-but-set-variable for autogenerated code
      s4:modules: Move structs with dynamic arrays to end of struct
      s3:modules: Initialize pointer with NULL
      s3:netapi: Remove unused variables
      s3:utils: Remove unused variable
      s3:torture: Remove unused variable
      waf: Add support for MemorySanitizer
      lib:ldb: Add the location to ldb_kv_parse_data_unpack() debug output
      lib:ldb: Print a debug message in case we have a corrupted MDB
      testprogs: Use random usernames for kinit tests
      testprogs: Use random usernames for export keytab tests
      testprogs: Use random user names for kpasswd tests
      python:tests: Correctly escape $ in user_edit.sh
      python:tests: Use a random username for user_edit.sh tests
      python:tests: Correctly escape $ in contact_edit.sh
      python:tests: Use a random username for contact_edit.sh test
      python:tests: Correctly escape $ in computer_edit.sh
      python:tests: Use a random machine name for computer_edit.sh test
      python:tests: Make sure we do not run into issues with already existing users
      python:tests: Fix domain_backup test with Python 3.11
      python:tests: Tell dns.resolver to not read /etc/resolv.conf
      python:tests: Add missing result checks for samba_tool.gpo tests
      python:tests: Make sure we delete the OU for movetest
      s3:utils: Check if the autorid rangesize is a multiple of the range
      s3:winbind: Improve warning message if we are out of autorid ranges
      python:netcmd: Decode return value of find_netbios() from bytes into string
      lib:ldb: Correctly cast pointers for assert_string_equal()
      ctdb:client: Fix code spelling
      ctdb:common: Fix code spelling
      ctdb:include: Remove trailing whitespaces in ctdb_protocol.h
      ctdb:include: Fix code spelling
      ctdb:server: Remove trailing whitespaces in ctdb_recover.c
      ctdb:server: Remove trailing whitespaces in ctdb_server.c
      ctdb:server: Fix code spelling
      ctdb:tcp: Fix code spelling

      s3:tests: Add test with testdenied_upn@REALM.upn
      auth: Remove trailing white spaces in credentials.h

      auth: Add cli_credentials_is_password_nt_hash()

Support user-provided file realm and roles & refactor ES user management (#2682)


## Defining users and roles in Kubernetes secrets

This PR adds support for user-provided file realm and roles, through Kubernetes secrets.
File realm and roles secrets must be referenced in the Elasticsearch CRD. The secret content must match the file realm and file-based roles specification from the Elasticsearch documentation.

Example:

```yaml
apiVersion: elasticsearch.k8s.elastic.co/v1
kind: Elasticsearch
metadata:
  name: elasticsearch-sample
spec:
  version: 7.6.0
  auth:
    roles:
    - secretName: my-roles-1
    fileRealm:
    - secretName: my-filerealm-secret

---

# File realm in ES format (from the CLI or manually assembled)
kind: Secret
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: my-filerealm-secret
stringData:
  users: |-
    rdeniro:$2a$10$BBJ/ILiyJ1eBTYoRKxkqbuDEdYECplvxnqQ47uiowE7yGqvCEgj9W
    alpacino:$2a$10$cNwHnElYiMYZ/T3K4PvzGeJ1KbpXZp2PfoQD.gfaVdImnHOwIuBKS
    jacknich:{PBKDF2}50000$z1CLJt0MEFjkIK5iEfgvfnA6xq7lF25uasspsTKSo5Q=$XxCVLbaKDimOdyWgLCLJiyoiWpA/XDMe/xtVgn1r5Sg=
  users_roles: |-
    admin:rdeniro
    power_user:alpacino,jacknich
    user:jacknich

---

# Roles in ES format
kind: Secret
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: my-roles-1
stringData:
  roles.yml: |-
    click_admins:
      run_as: [ 'clicks_watcher_1' ]
      cluster: [ 'monitor' ]
      indices:
      - names: [ 'events-*' ]
        privileges: [ 'read' ]
        field_security:
          grant: ['category', '@timestamp', 'message' ]
        query: '{"match": {"category": "click"}}'
    another_role:
      cluster: [ 'all' ]
```

An aggregate secret is built from:
- predefined "internal" users (the `elastic` user, the readiness probe user, the controller user)
- associated users (from Kibana or APMServer associations)
- the user-provided file realm
- internal roles (the readiness probe custom role)
- user-provided roles
and mounted into all Elasticsearch Pods.

User-provided file realm and roles get precedence over internal ones.

This PR also adds an E2E test for user-provided file realm and roles.

## Refactoring

I decided to refactor our Elasticsearch user management code, because I had a hard time figuring out how the existing User and Credentials abstraction mapped to Kubernetes resources, and fitting the new file realm concept into it.

As a result of this refactoring:
- there is no more `Credentials` concept (hashed credentials vs. cleartext credentials)
- predefined users, associated users and user-provided users are separated in their own file
- there is no more common `User` pkg: it was actually mostly useful for Elasticsearch
- it is replaced by an internal private `user` type that can easily transform to a file realm
- association code may relies on the `elasticsearch/user/associated.go` code, which described an `AssociatedUser` and holds all the associated consts
- users reconciliations consists in building file realms for all sort of users and merging those together
- we don't inspect password vs. hash when updating secrets in the reconciler, through `credentials.NeedsUpdate()` (I think that part of the code was hard to grasp). Instead we just reuse existing passwords and hashes when building predefined users in the first place. The secret reconciliation is simpler imo.

Sorry for the super big PR including both the feature & refactoring. Doing one without the other did not make much sense.

------------------

Squashed commits:

* Add auth with filerealm and roles secret ref to the CRD

* Add a filerealm pkg to manipulate the filerealm content

* Manipulate roles in a dedicated file away from the file realm

* Remove the Credentials abstraction for simplification

* Simplify the user struct and generate a filerealm from it

* Reconcile predefined internal users

* Reconcile the user-provided file realm

* Add a helper function to watch user-provided secrets

* Remove the common user abstraction

* Replace the common ExternalUser by an es-specific AssociatedUser

* Move util functions from user to utils pkg

* Propagate constants move to import paths in other files

* Add string helper funcs

* Rename xpack file realm refs to roles + file realm

* Remove the previous users & file realm reconciliation

* Reconcile the aggregate file realm and roles

* The users reconciliation now returns a single controller user

* Add an E2E test for user-provided auth

* Fix linter warnings

* Emit an event but don't error out on referenced secret error

* Fix typos and comments

* The internal roleUsersMapping should always be sorted

* Add unit tests for users and users_roles parsing

* Consistent error format

* Regenerate CRDs

* Rename esclient.UserAuth to esclient.BasicAuth

* Rename files to be closer to file realm concepts

* Rename roleUsersMapping to usersRoles to avoid confusion

* Fix comments

* Remove roles and file realm secret watches on ES deletion

* Fixes from PR review

* Regenerate CRDs and api docs

* Regenerate CRDs and api docs
